授業目的: 本講義の目的は、学生が主体的に、古代から現代に至る日本の伝統芸能の歴史や特徴を学ぶとともに、芸能が果たした文化史の面での意義や社会的な役割についても考察する。
到達目標: The students will gain a comprehensive knowledge of Japanese traditional performance culture and deepen their understanding of both the historical and social factors that formed the various performing art forms and the intricate workings of power, cultural representation, and gender.
特記事項:

The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.

【合併】総合日本学習科目（伝統芸能）（CIEC）/Traditional Japanese Theatre（国際学部）
関連科目: There is no prerequisite for this course but a related course would be any standard course on Japanese culture, history and literature.
授業の概要・背景: This course introduces students to performing arts in Japanese traditional culture, in the broad sense of the term performance: as a cultural representation literally imbued with meanings, both artistic and social. We examine the main stage arts not only as forms of entertainment but also in their historical, social and cultural contexts: the early forms kagura and bugaku, the classical noh drama and the kyogen comedy, the puppet theatre bunraku, the actor’s theatre kabuki, the all-female Takarazuka Revue, and various folk genres. Special attention is paid to the performance of gender and the body in Japanese culture, and particularly to the female performers in the predominantly male theatrical tradition. The course provides the students with a firm foundation from which a deeper understanding of the role of performing arts in Japanese culture and society is built. We will also explore the role and state of traditional performing arts in the current situation of pandemic.
